faq.title: Do you have any other questions?

1.name: Just tell me what I should do?
1.answer: Download Shuffle app, register and subscribe to 'PRO'. You can do it by going to the 'Profile' app section, clicking on the gear at the top left (Settings) and going to 'Edit profile'. There, click the PRO button. Don't forget that initially you are a regular user of the app and you can just see how everything works, because your events will become part of all this. This is important, you will be able to understand what to focus on, how your events will be seen by others.Other users see your activity, look at your profile and your events, and subscribe to you.

2.name: What do I need to pay for?
2.answer: You have two weeks trial period. Then the cost of a subscription is a couple of cups of coffee. Inside, all the basic functionality is free. There are paid functions, but this is optional. There isa percentage of the ticket price that is retained by the booking system.

3.name: The booking – how to accept money?
3.answer: You set up the booking system for yourself. Money goes through integration with our partner Stripe, where you register and verify yourself. This is security for you and for our users - your clients. Cryptocurrency operates within the framework of standard exchange and blockchain procedures.

4.name: Is it necessary to integrate or insert some counters?
4.answer: No. Shuffle is a complete ecosystem in which you have a detailed block of all the necessary statistics, including unique indicators that you can use to pump up your events, detail your work with the audience

5.name: Where do you get your users from?
5.answer: We work with social networks, contextual advertising. We work with partner networks and offline events. We have large coverage. We also highlight your events everywhere.

6.name: Is Shuffle better then Instagram and Telegram?
6.answer: These are fundamentally different platforms. There are 'everything for everyone' and specialized ones. Instagram and Telegram have a general audience that consumes visual or text content. Shuffle has users who specifically observe the life of a metropolis, where places and events is the main content. Large services do not have any specific specialized tools, while Shuffle has everything to work with events.
